segments.text: gives you a million dollar check and you can do anything you want to with it except you must give it to Texas A&M but you get to decide what they do with the million dollars.
If you had a million dollars you could give to them, what would you want A&M to do with it?
What would be your favorite cause?
Well,
I would give half of it right offhand, half of it to a scholarship fund.
And not, you're going to think this is not good, but I wouldn't,
I don't necessarily want that scholarship based on need.
If you want to figure a little bit of need in, I don't want that to disqualify anybody or qualify anybody.
Hopefully... How would they pick the recipients?
That they pick the recipient by...
a deserving person and not somebody that has a genuine desire to learn and to be good for humanity.
What about the other half?
And the other half, and this sounds awfully bad because of my son's recent
But I've been active for many years in the association.
I'd give the other to the association as unrestricted funds.
Okay.
And they would probably take a goodly amount of it and place it into the foundation.
which is completely really controlled by the former students.
But I've let them have a backlog to do so many things that the association has to do.
And this has been a feeling of mine for a long time.
I hate to say this because they're all worthy.
The College of Veterinary Medicine, the College of Engineering, the College of Geosciences, all of the different colleges, they're all deserving.
and the Corps cadets and everything, and God knows I love the Corps.
But the association has supported all of these things for so many years, they get no credit for it.
Which they're not really looking for credit, but they, now all of these,
outfits are going on separate fundraising ventures and even so they still expect the support of the association.
And somehow this has to be worked out amicably.
Last question.
What feelings do you hold in your heart now for Texas A&M?
I love it.
That's about all I can say.
I love it.
